titles.title: USPS Act
Upholding a Secure Postal System Act
USPS Act
To require the Comptroller General of the United States to submit reports to Congress on theft of mail and United States Postal Service property, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

bill.summary:
Upholding a Secure Postal System Act or the USPS Act
This bill requires the Government Accountability Office to investigate nationwide patterns and instances of theft of mail and U.S. Postal Service (USPS) property and report to Congress.
Any such report must include a description of any measures that the USPS has in place to address, and recommendations on how the USPS and Congress can combat, such theft.
